- [Narrator] Energy downstream
facilities are complex.
A network of personnel, equipment,
processes and infrastructure.

A massive operation to
support the safe, reliable

and profitable manufacturing
of finished products.

Despite the scale, the
day-to-day workflows
for many facilities are still manual.

- Meaning they are handled
with paper, spreadsheets,
person-to-person communication,
methods that are long-trusted and accepted

but may slow down efficiency,
control and response times.

- [Narrator] Modernizing
the daily workflow

could have major impacts
for downstream facilities.
- The AWS Connected Field Work Solution

is a cloud native field
services management offering,
which combines core operational resources
into a single digital workflow.

- [Narrator] The solution
provides real-time visibility
into field critical workflows

in one centralized web
and mobile-based platform

that can help field
personnel complete job tasks
accurately, safely and efficiently.
The AWS Connected Field Work Solution
supports quality assurance,
reduces health and safety risk,

increases collaboration
and improves productivity.
- McKinsey and Company stated
that digital work management systems
are delivering value in these ways

that can lead to operational
cost reductions of 15 to 30%.

This solution comes with
technical accelerators to initiate

and complete the deployment
for the end user.
And for those who want a more commercial
off-the-shelf offering,
the solution comes with vetted

out-of-the-box software
as a service applications
from our software technology partners.

The solution also comes with
AWS Professional Services
and consulting partner offerings
to build something more bespoke
and customized for the end users.
- [Narrator] Start the conversation today

about how the AWS Connected
Field Work Solution

can benefit your downstream
operations facility.
